title.rendered: Ooh – my photo on a BILLBOARD!

content.rendered:
Well, it’s been an amazing year on loads of levels. I’ve been lucky enough to photograph some fantastic people and places and I am super chuffed to round it off with the news that my photos of Greg Rutherford for the charity Right to Play are now appearing on a billboard near you. This one, at Highbury Corner, is looking a bit soggy and bedraggled after all the rain.

Other pics of Greg, and of Liam Tancock and Caitlin McClatchey are appearing on posters, bus shelters and online – it’s all part of the charity’s I Believe campaign, aimed at promoting sports, rights and development around the world.

In other news, my photo Uluru Walkers is gracing the cover of the latest issue of fLIP magazine. This image, made during my trip to Australia in March, has proved to be quite popular – it was selected for the London Independent Photography annual exhibition at the Strand Gallery, and also led to my work being featured on the Print Space blog a couple of months ago.

This week I’m carrying out my annual think-dream-plan session and I can’t begin to tell you how excited I am about the year to come.

Happy festivities – and see you in 2013!
